author: Staff Reporter
text:
R. Vaithilingam, Minister for Housing, Urban Development and Agriculture, and P. Mohan, Rural Industries Minister, pay floral tributes to former Chief Minister P. Ramaswamy Reddiyar at Tindivanam on Monday.— Photo : Special Arrangement

The Tamil Nadu Reddy Nala Sangam (TNRNS) has urged the government to include the life history of former Chief Minister P. Ramaswamy Reddiyar (Omandurar) in school curriculum.

A resolution was adopted at his 121st birth anniversary celebrations and special State-level conference held in Tindivanam on Monday.

The sangam adopted another resolution urging the government to include all sub-sects of the community, except Konda Reddy, in the list of other backward communities. It also wanted the Puducherry government to issue an order to ensure hassle-free and immediate distribution of community certificates to members belonging to Reddy(Ganjam) community. Through another resolution, the association wanted the Tamil Nadu government to issue an order to make Telugu the second language in all schools in the State.

Earlier, Union Minister for Urban Development M. Venkaiah Naidu released a souvenir for the conference.

G.R. Reddy, president of TNRNS, R. Vaithilingam, Minister for Housing, Urban Development and Agriculture, and PMK founder S. Ramadoss are among those who participated.

title: ‘Include Omandurar’s story in school curriculum’
